Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Reverend Dr. Allen Pinckney, Jr. of Butler Memorial United Methodist Church, 3920 Paulding Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10466.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member King.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Dr. Allen Pinckney, Jr., of Butler Memorial United Methodist Church, 3920 Paulding Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10466.

Council Member King moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 11, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Grodenchik.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Grodenchik moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 11, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 180458 ZSK (570 Fulton Street Rezoning) shall be subject to Council review. This application is related to Application Nos. N 180457 ZRK and C 180459 ZMK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 570 Fulton Street Rezoning, Brooklyn (N 180457 ZRK, C 180458 ZSK and C 180459 ZMK)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 180389 ZSK and C 180387 ZSK (12 Franklin Street)  shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to Application No. N 180388 ZRK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 12 Franklin Street, Brooklyn (C 180387 ZSK, N 180388 ZRK and C 180389 ZSK)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 190037 ZSK (461 Alabama Avenue)  shall be subject to Council review. This application is related to Application Nos. C 190038 HAK and C 190039 HUK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, 461 Alabama Ave, Brooklyn (C 190037 ZSK, C 190038 HAK and C 190039)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution recognizing January 27, 2019 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on January 27, 2019 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing 1/27/19 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on 1/27/19 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of the City of New York seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the Mayor of NYC to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of NYC seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an office of constituent services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Office of constituent services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on arrests, summonses, removals, escorts and use of force incidents occurring in department of social services/human resources administration job centers and SNAP centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reporting on arrests, summonses, removals, escorts and use of force incidents occurring in department of social services/human resources administration job centers and SNAP centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the board of correction to report on the department of correction’s grievance process
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Requiring the board of correction to conduct surveys of the correctional system’s grievance process.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for the provision of social work services at department of social services/human resources administration job centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program for the provision of social work services at department of social services/human resources administration job centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring space for children at department of social services/human resources administration job centers and SNAP centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring space for children at dept of social services/human resources administration job centers and SNAP centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to de-escalation and trauma-informed training
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: De-escalation and trauma-informed training.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on affordable housing set-asides for tenants with disabilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Reporting on affordable housing set-asides for tenants with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the grievance process for incarcerated individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Grievance process for incarcerated individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing information about lawful source of income discrimination to applicants for the city fighting homelessness and eviction prevention supplement program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Providing information about lawful source of income discrimination to applicants for the city fighting homelessness and eviction prevention supplement program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to fire lanes in open parking lots that can store over 100 vehicles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fire lanes in open parking lots that can store over 100 vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a report and website posting on Department of Education employees terminated for the abuse of students
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Report and website posting on Department of Education employees terminated for the abuse of students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer affairs to send documents related to licensing by certified mail
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of consumer affairs to send documents related to licensing by certified mail.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of transportation to study safety measures for outdoor train platforms
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOT to study safety measures for outdoor train platforms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of flavored cigarettes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of flavored cigarettes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that eliminates the mortgage recording tax.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Eliminates the mortgage recording tax.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President sign, legislation that would declare Election Day, the Tuesday following the first Monday in November, a national holiday.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Declare Election Day, the Tuesday following the first Monday in November, a national holiday.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor sign, legislation that would declare Election Day, the Tuesday following the first Monday in November, a state holiday.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Declare Election Day, the Tuesday following the first Monday in November, a state holiday.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: 911 Anti-Discrimination Act (S.9149)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to report information regarding sexual health education.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and  Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

The office of Public Advocate is vacant pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the February 26, 2019 citywide Special Election.  The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) assumed the chair as the Acting President Pro Tempore.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)
